oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Pvt. Lee Roy Morris, Co. I, 804th Pioneer Inf. Regt.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph showing Pvt. Lee Roy Morris of Jackson (Tenn.) in uniform. Morris was born in Madison County, Tenn., to Farris Whit and Ella Newborn Morris on February 10, 1896. He enlisted in the U.S. Army on June 5, 1917, and served in Co. I, 804th Pioneer Inf. Regt., comprised entirely of African American soldiers. In September 1918, the 804th was deployed to France. They received approximately two months of training and spent their time in France working under the command of the Army Engineers. They returned to the States in July 1919 and Morris was honorably discharged on September 10, 1919. He moved back to his parents' farm in Madison County where he married Mary (Onia Mae) Taylor and started a family.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Morris, Lee Roy
